de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.overlay
Interface KBR

public interface KBR

The Common API for Downcalls from Paper "Towards a Common API for Structured Peer-to-Peer Overlays"

Author:
Eser

Method Detail

route

void route(OverlayKey key,
           Message msg,
           OverlayContact hint)
This operation forwards a message msg towards the root of OverlayKey key. The optional hint argument speficies a OverlayContact that should be used as a first hop in routing the message. A good hint, e.g. one that refers to the OverlayKey’s current root, can result in the message being delivered in one hop; a bad hint adds at most one extra hop to the route. Either key or hint may be null, but not both. The operation provides a best-effort service: the message may be lost, duplicated, corrupted, or delayed indefinitely.

Parameters:
key - the specified key
msg - the message to route
hint - the speficied

replicaSet

java.util.List<OverlayContact> replicaSet(OverlayKey key,
                                          int maxRank)
This operation returns an ordered list of OverlayContacts on which replicas of the object with key key can be stored. The call returns nodes with a rank up to and including max rank.

Parameters:
key -
maxRank -
Returns:
the list of ordered OverlayContacts

neighborSet

java.util.List<OverlayContact> neighborSet(int num)
This operation produces an unordered list of OverlayContacts that are neighbors of the local node in the ID space. Up to num OverlayContact are returned.

Parameters:
num - Maximum number of OverlayContatcs returned
Returns:
list of unordered OverlayContacts
